subject: Art & Design
title: Licensing: Why Free Fonts Aren't Always Free
description: A fast breakdown of Licensing: Why Free Fonts Aren't Always Free for builders.

hook.text: A startup used a 'free' font on their product. Then they got a $20,000 licensing invoice.

buildup.text: Fonts have licenses. Free for personal use often means paid for commercial use.

discovery.text: Google Fonts are truly free (open source). Many others require per-seat or per-pageview licenses.

twist.text: Embedding a licensed font in a mobile app can cost thousands â€” separate from the web license.

climax.text: Always check the license before shipping. 'I downloaded it' is not a legal defense.

punchline.text: The font is free until the lawyer says otherwise.

quiz.question: What does 'free for personal use' mean for fonts?
options: Commercial use (products, websites) may require a paid license
You can use it anywhere without restrictions
It only works on free software
